text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 5.1.20.1: Replaced Overview with content to comply with the new Internal Management Documents System, IRM internal control requirements.
5.1.20.3.3: Moved Federal Employee/Retiree Delinquency Initiative (FERDI) cases from note to item as they cannot be moved to the Queue.

IRM 5.1.20.3.3: Moved Restrictive Conditions to IRM 5.1.20.3.4 as these cases cannot be moved from their present assignment to any other assignment, not just a Queue limitation. Also removed CSED notation as it is contained in the restrictive condition list.

IRM 5.1.20.3.4: Removed Disaster Code = 1 (-S Freeze Code) from restriction. Compliance is not waived by IDRS for these cases. Also removed Left Hand Freeze Code O- notation as it is contained in the restrictive condition list.
Revised text for editorial changes throughout the
This IRM supersedes IRM 5.1.20 dated November 2, 2016.
SB/SE Field Collection (FC) employees.
Director, Collection Inventory, Delivery and Selection Small Business/Self Employed
Table of Contents

) Purpose: This section provides an overview of the systemic collection inventory routing systems and process including: • Inventory Delivery System (IDS) • Integrated Collected System (ICS) • ENTITY Case Management System (ENTITY) (

) Collection inventory is systemically routed using systemic scoring and systems and mechanisms to ensure fairness and integrity. Systemic making ensures that no one individual can control the enforcement decision-making process, which aligns with Policy Statement P-
) Audience: • Small Business/Self Employed Field Collection (FC) employees including Territory Managers, Group Managers, and Revenue • Automated Collection System (ACS) managers and employees (
) Policy Owner: Director, Headquarters Collection (
) Program Owner: Director, Collection Inventory Delivery and Selection (
) Program Goals: Efficiently identify, route and prioritize inventory to be by the collection functions (
) Collection inventory that has not been resolved during the notice stream is temically routed to the collection functions by IDS. (
) Field Collection uses two inventory management applications, ENTITY and ICS, to prioritize, assign and maintain inventory. (
) Automated Collection System employees use the ACS inventory system to prioritize, assign and maintain inventory. (
) The Director, Collection Inventory Delivery and Selection is responsible for cedures related to collection inventory delivery. (
) The SBSE Collection Analytics, Routing and Selection (CARS) Analysts oversight over the program. (
) The SBSE Collection Case Delivery (CCD) Analysts have oversight over ENTITY and ICS programs. (
) The SBSE Collection Strategic Analysis and Modeling (SAM) Analysts have oversight over the predictive models. (
) Field Collection Group Managers (GMs) and Revenue Officers (ROs) are sponsible for maintaining their assigned inventory. (
) ACS Managers, leads and employees are responsible for maintaining their assigned inventory. (
) Program Reviews: • CARS Analysts complete a annual review the business rules to their continued effectiveness. Internal Revenue Manual
Collection inventory that has not been resolved during the notice stream is temically routed to the collection functions by IDS.
CARS Analysts complete a annual review the business rules to ensure their continued effectiveness.
SAM Analysts complete a annual model evaluation to monitor their ef- fectiveness and update as needed.

CARS Analysts run weekly and monthly IDS reports to monitor case processing status and volumes. ENTITY contains multiple reports to monitor both Queue and FC inventory. Reports are regularly run by HQ Analysts, CCD and FC agement.

) IDS routes cases for ﬁnal prioritization and assignment to: • FC • Queue • ACS • A
b (

) IDS uses advanced data analytics such as predictive modeling techniques, case grade, and routing indicators to systemically prioritize cases for Note: While IDS uses data analytics to prioritize cases for routing, IDS does determine the priority of cases within each of the functions. (
) Model scores are used to indicate the likelihood a predicted case outcome occur. Scores are calculated for cases with an Master File Tax code
, or
module and are used to prioritize certain cases for assignment. also passes the scores to each function’s case management system to the ﬁnal prioritization determination. (

) IDS uses established case grading business rules to determine the grade level of cases. Note: Cases not graded by IDS will continue to receive their grade from and Workload Management System (RWMS). IRM

the criteria used by RWMS to determine the case grade. (
) IDS creates a higher precedence routing indicator for some cases. This indicator is later utilized by the business rules in some routing decisions. (
) IDS business rules are used to route cases to the collection functions. tion Policy establishes the rules to support the collection program (
) IDS uses the business rules to route cases to: a. Field Collection (Direct assignment) b. Queue c. ACS d. A
b (

The following cases (whether directly assigned or later routed to ICS) are re- stricted from moving from their present assignment. These cases cannot be sent to the queue and they are not transferable, etc., when the following tions are present: • Disaster code
, or
• Any IMF case with a Killed in Terrorist Action (KITA) indicator

Note: If any restrictive conditions are present on a module/account, IDRS will not update the status or resume balance due TDA issuance until all restrictive conditions are removed. conditions must be taken into consideration when a code or transaction code are input to reactivate the balance notice/TDA routine.

If any restrictive conditions are present on a module/account, IDRS will not update the status or resume balance due notice/ TDA issuance until all restrictive conditions are removed. These conditions must be taken into consideration when a command code or transaction code are input to reactivate the balance due notice/TDA routine.
ENTITY and ICS. ENTITY supports essential FC activities:
Inventory Management
case data, reports and queries available in ENTITY can be used by GMs and ROs to manage inventory.
Case Selection/Assignment
The GM Case Assignment function in ENTITY is the primary method Field Collection GMs use to assign inventory from the Queue to ROs in their group.
Time Reports – FC End of Month (EOM) reports are generated and approved in ENTITY.
ICS supports essential FC workload management:

• Electronic case management – assignments, open and close case actions • Electronic case documentation – contact and history recordation • Electronic Notice of Federal Tax Lien requests – requests extracted Automated Lien System (ALS) (

) ENTITY is a current database of Field Collection ; Field Offer in and Advisory inventories. The ENTITY application receives data from ICS open, closed and return to queue cases; the Delinquent Inventory Account System (DIAL) for queue cases; and the Automated Lien System (ALS) for lien mation on all cases. (

) ENTITY data and report are used by FC management to manage inventory. ENTITY reports can be run at the revenue officer, group, territory, area or national levels depending on the ENTITY user’s proﬁle (

) The GM Case Assignment function available in ENTITY is the primary Field Collection GMs use to assign inventory from the Queue to ROs in group. Predictive productive model data is used to prioritize TDA and TDI cases for selection. (
) ENTITY uses the business rules and case characteristics to present for assignment from the following priority levels and categories: •
, Accelerated •
, High Priority Note: Many Priority
cases are transfers from ACS assigned to the GM Hold ﬁle •
, Medium Priority •
, Low Priority Exception: Priority

is the default priority level for non-IDRS ments and is not associated with the priority of the For example, an OI issued by Centralized Case (CCP) for collection on a pyramiding in-business may be assigned priority level
but is a high priority
actions Electronic case documentation – contact and history recordation Electronic Notice of Federal Tax Lien requests – requests extracted to Automated Lien System (ALS)
ENTITY uses the business rules and case characteristics to present inventory for assignment from the following priority levels and categories:
Priority

is the default priority level for non-IDRS assign- ments and is not associated with the priority of the case. For example, an OI issued by Centralized Case Processing (CCP) for collection on a pyramiding in-business taxpayer may be assigned priority level
but is a high priority case.

) ICS provides workload management, case assignment/tracking, inventory control, electronic processing, and case analysis tools to support the SB/SE organization collection ﬁeldwork. ICS is a Windows based software applica- tion. Its architecture consists of two layers of hardware and software. The ﬁrst tier consists of the ICS mainframe and is located at the Tennessee Computing Center. The second tier consists of Windows based software on Workstations which are located at each person’s workspace.
5.1.20.4.3 (11-02-2016) Integrated Collection System
